Class java.Nutmeg.SortedCollection 

java.lang.Object

   +----java.Nutmeg.Collection

           +----java.Nutmeg.IndexedCollection

                   +----java.Nutmeg.OrderedCollection
                           |
                           +----java.Nutmeg.SortedCollection
public class SortedCollection
extends OrderedCollection
Copyright (c) 1995, 1996 THOUGHT Inc. All Rights Reserved.

SortedCollection class (a growable array).

This is a SortedCollection type which is sortable by multiple algorithms. It depends on the Sortable or CSortable (derived from Cloneable interface), and requires that members are of that class in order to be able to use the default sorting class - SortBlock. To enforce this we currently thrown an exception if anything but an object of Sortable or CSortable type is added to this Collection class. This class should be considered VERY beta because we hope to get sufficient additions to the Java class library API to be able to do this in a more clean fashion for our First real release. NOTE:SortBlock is not supported in this release, but will be included in some later release. To control sort order, properly implement an Object to be Sorted by deriving it from the Sortable interface.

localSortBlock
The buffer.
useSortBlockForOrdering
The flag for determining if default ordering will be used, or if the SortBlock will be used to determine ordering.

SortedCollection 
  public SortedCollection(int initialSize,
                          int growSize)
Constructor for SortedCollection with an initial storage capacity and a specified growSize.
Parameters:
initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage
growSize - the increment that storage should grow by size doubles if value is 0.
SortedCollection 
  public SortedCollection(int initialSize)
Constructs an empty SortedCollection with the specified storage capacity, and a default capacity increment. Capacity increment is defaulted to 0 using this constructor.
Parameters:
initialSize - initial storage capacity of data storage.
SortedCollection 
  public SortedCollection()
Construct an empty SortedCollection. This defaults to an initial storage capacity of 10 objects, and a growSize of 0.

  public synchronized void useSortBlock()

  public synchronized void noSortBlock()
